result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randy Thomas Bedell

records.addlTxt: 9:52 AM Called 22CF73, 22CF142, 22TR226, 22TR227, 22TR228 set for STC. Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Randy Thomas Bedell not in court, fails to appear.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Randy Thomas Bedell.  Def fails to appear by any means, $500 posted.  State requests default all of the TR matters including the OWI 1st standard dispo and CF cases ask to forfeit cash and Warrant nationwide.  Attny Pollak stands mute.  Court will default TR's, 22TR227 $200.50 and 3 pts, in 22TR228 $937.50 and 6 pts, Revoke DL for 6 months with credit for any admin suspension, OWI  assessment and Driver safety plan.  22CF142 already has WA, orders WA in other and forfeit cash, which will go toward TR ticket matters first.
Status conference on August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:06 AM Cases 22CF73 and 22TR226-228 called together.  Defendant, Randy Thomas Bedell, appeared with Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  Def appears telephonically w/court approval.  Case 22CF73 on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  STC requested.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:18 AM Called 22CF73 for PH and 22TR226, 22TR227 and 22TR228 for STC.  Defendant, Randy Thomas Bedell, appeared with Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  All parties appeared in person.  Case is on for preliminary hearing.  State calls first witness, Deputy Greg Chafer, who is sworn in and testifies.  Witness has identified the defendant Mr. Bedell.  Venue is made.  State would rest.  Attny Pollak questions Deputy Chafer.  State objects, speculation.  Sustained, answer stricken.  Attny Pollak continues questioning Deputy Chafer.  Attny Pollak has no further questions. State would rest and ask for a bind over.  Deputy Chafer steps down.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matter is bound over for further proceedings.  The State files information, mirrors the criminal complaint.  Arraignment scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

01:41 PM Called 22CF65 for extradition hearing, 22CF73 for INIT and 22TR226, 22TR227 and 22TR228 for Intake.  Defendant Randy Thomas Bedell in court by video, in custody of Burnett County jail.  ADA Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Randy Thomas Bedell appeared by video means.  Attny Pollak appeared especially today as Def qualifies for PD but no one appointed yet.  Court notes it appears that def has paid $500 bond but extradition hearing to MN.  Attny Pollak has not talked with def, but def does qualify for PD.  Judge has signed extradition forms here.  Court asks how def pleads in TR cases, def replies NG to all, NG pleas entered on his behalf in TR cases.  22CF73 has 5 counts, Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Court asks if Vic name confidential as a police officer?  ADA will look into it.  Court reads charges, counts 1 and 2 and their possible penalties, def has questions, Attny Pollak asks if he may go over criminal complaint with def by zoom.  Off the record at 1:47pm.  
Back on the record at 1:52pm, same appearances as previously noted.  Attny Pollak had a confidential break-out session with def to review criminal complaint.  Def has been read and understands criminal complaint, waive time limits on PH.  Def confirms contact info.  NG entered on all TR's and misdemeanor count.
Court reviews extradition papers back to MN, Def sworn in by Judge.  Court has 3 affidavit's that appeared to be signed by the def, waiver of extradition of hearing.  Def confirms he wishes to be extradited to MN.  Court reviews def's rights to an attny and extradition hearing.  Forms waiving extradition and extradition hearing.  Def confirms that is his signature.  Def has had no threats, and fully understands what he is doing.  Voluntarily extradited to MN.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 16, 2022 at 10:15 am.

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim or residence outside of victim's official capacity.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
